intro: Neckia lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved neckia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Gentianaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of the Americas, particularly found in countries like Brazil and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, blue or violet flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
